review: To anyone considering buying this device, be very aware, the Amazon Fire TV does not offer a web browser of any type that I have been able to find.  I have searched every option I could, and nowhere in the store, nor by using voice commands is there any way to find and install a web browser.  Honestly, this was the Main reason I purchased the device, so my mother could watch some of the shows she watches on her android tablet, and even though the app store is supposedly on the Fire TV, try finding a browser, nothing comes up.  Everything else works fine, but what is the point in an android device for your TV that does not have all the features android offers?
author: John L. Garza "gamewiz1"

review: Absolutely freakin' love it. If fire TV offered local channels I would cancel my cable in an instant. It offers a little of everything for everyone. I currently own 2 Roku boxes at different locations in my home and I can tell you, Fire TV is superior in navigation, layout and performance. And the price is a no-brainer.

author: Richard Lara

review: If the remote hadn't died in the first week this would have been awesome. Guess I will have to buy a new remote for this. I honestly regret getting this now when at first I was excited. I emailed Amazon with the troubleshooting I did and I received a response saying to call them to troubleshoot it. If I cannot be helped through the email section and I am going to be asked to repeat steps I already took then get rid of your email option and don't waste our time. I work in Information Systems for a living and have to do a lot of work with the Help Desk and this wouldn't fly at my company. I buy a ton through Amazon and this kind of soured me since it is their product. Accidents happen and defects will be found but at least have decent customer service to resolve it. I am sure a lot of people have good things to say about it and I just got a bad apple. But that is my two cents. I have the Chromecast and Roku (An original Roku) and they both still work fine. If you already have a streaming device don't put yourself through the headache like I did.
author: Charles Lawry-Martinez "Virtus Junxit Mors Non Separabit"
